description: Erection of a three-bedroom detached house with associated fencing, landscaping, cycle and bin storage, together with changes to the existing house comprising alterations to the fenestration and demolition of the front porch.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (9333/ 001 Rev C, 9333/ 002 Rev C, 9333/ 003 Rev C, 9333/ 004 Rev C, 9333/ 005 Rev C, 9333/ 006 Rev C, 9333/ 007 Rev C, 9333/ 008 Rev C, 9333/ 009 Rev C, 9333/ 010 Rev C, 9333/ 025 Rev C, 9333/ 026 Rev C, 9333/ 027 Rev C, 9333/ 028 Rev C, Design and Access Statement & Heritage Statement. Received on 11/08/2021; Fire Statement. Received on 08/09/2021; 9333/ 011 Rev D, 9333/ 012 Rev D, 9333/ 013 Rev D, 9333/ 014 Rev D, 9333/ 015 Rev D, 9333/ 016 Rev D, 9333/ 017 Rev D, 9333/ 019 Rev D, 9333/ 020 Rev D, 9333/ 021 Rev D & 9333/ 022 Rev D. Received on 05/11/2021; 9333/ 018 Rev E & 9333/ 023 Rev E. Received on 10/02/2022; Energy Strategy & SAP Calculations. Received on 21/02/2022; 9333/ 024 Rev E. Received on 14/03/2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Prior to any demolition and construction work, neighbours shall be given details outlining construction timeframes (including when demolition and piling will take place).

Condition : 5 - The ground floor toilet window formed in the side elevation as shown on drawing numbers 9333/ 013 Rev D & 9333/ 023 Rev E, the first floor bathroom and hallway windows in the side elevation as shown on drawing numbers 9333/ 014 Rev D & 9333/ 015 Rev D and the second floor bathroom window formed in the front elevation as shown on drawing number 9333/ 016 Rev D of the hereby approved three-bedroom detached house shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the hereby approved three-bedroom detached house or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 7 - a)	No development shall take place until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council that will secure the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Statement hereby approved. 

b)	Prior to first occupation of the three-bedroom detached house hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

c)	Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the approved three-bedroom detached house evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 9 - The three-bedroom detached house hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:

At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.

At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.

No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 10 - The front, sides and rear garden shall be divided as shown on the plan drawing numbered 9333/ 011 Revision D and thereafter maintained as such for the duration of the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the three-bedroom detached house hereby approved a detailed plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected along the front, side and rear of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The boundary treatment shall be completed before the three-bedroom detached house is occupied or in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the local planning authority.

Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 12 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development, details of hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained in accordance with such thereafter. Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

Condition : 13 - A splay of 2.4m x 2.4m shall be provided on each side of the access, the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, and no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6 m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected within the areas of such splays.

Condition : 14 - Prior to first occupation of the three-bedroom detached house hereby approved full details (including manufacturers specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 2 bicycles) for the occupants of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 15 - Prior to the first occupation of the three-bedroom detached house hereby approved development the waste and recycling store shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the duration of the development.
